intro: Euryops decipiens, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant produces bright yellow flower heads that open in the morning and close in the evening. It has hairy, narrow leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. Euryops decipiens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
